node.text: Yours is not a face I'm familiar with, so let me welcome you to our village! I am Madam Vinter, the matron of the village some might say. Have you come to join the festivities then?

option.optiontext: Anything disturbing the peace here?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
Actually, I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: Our village is peaceful, yes, but out in the wilds it's a different matter. As my friend Gordon has been telling me, goblin attacks on our lumberjacks has become unbearable. The Frostfang Goblins have even been stealing their village festival tokens - the spite on those creatures!

option.optiontext: Maybe I could teach the goblins a lesson for you.
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: But you must've made quite the journey to reach here, the Village of Evergreen Hearth! We're about the most remote settlement in the wilderness that is northern Imberthale, not many choose to live in such unforgiving land...

The folk who do come are usually here for one of two reasons - as lumberjacks to gather the exceptional Winterpine Wood, or as traders. Sometimes druid-folk come and go, and of course someone also has to look after all of these fools - that job lands on my shoulders.

option.optiontext: Tell me more about the land itself.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?
Anything disturbing the peace?
I see.

node.text: Outside of the safe haven that is our village? Winterpine Forests are a wild, untamed land full of beasts; noble ones for sure, like the Frost Wolf and the Elk, but nasty pests too that are the Goblin-kind.

Stronghearted lumberjacks brave the wilds for the Winterpine Wood though, which is well renowned for its properties. But it can get dangerous out there, maybe more so now than ever. The spiteful goblins have been quite active, you see. May that act as a word of warning also, if you mean to venture out there.

option.optiontext: I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?
Tell me something about your village.
Anything disturbing the peace?
Very well.

node.text: Why, it is the season for the Hearthlight Festival! Do you southeners not know of it? Out here it is tradition, to drive the cold and dark away, to warm our bodies and minds. We also exchange gifts for special tokens we share among each other - you too might find ways to earn, or even find some.

option.optiontext: Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
Anything disturbing the peace?
Very well.

node.text:
In fact... why don't I give you a few...?

<color=#9C8C77>*The lady pulls simple, decorated, wooden tokens out of her pockets and hands them to you.*</color>

There you go, happy Hearthlight Festival!

option.optiontext: Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
Anything disturbing the peace?

node.text: Oh, we would be most appreciative if you could! If you venture out into the woods, you'll find they've spread their camps all around, to the north, south and middle. Violence is the only language those vile creatures understand - please, we'll reward you, if you lay waste to their camps!\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Put the fear of death into the Frostfang Tribe by slaying 6 goblins at each of their three camps in the Winterpine Forests.*</color>

option.optiontext: Very well.

node.text: Greetings once again, stranger, I hope you'll take a moment to enjoy the village festivities. You said you might be able to help us with our goblin problem, dare I hope you bring news on that front?

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
You're the leader of the village?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: The folk who do come are usually here for one of two reasons - as lumberjacks to gather the exceptional Winterpine Wood, or as traders. Sometimes druid-folk come and go, and of course someone also has to look after all of these fools - that job lands on my shoulders.

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
You're the leader of the village?
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: Outside of the safe haven that is our village? Winterpine Forests are a wild, untamed land full of beasts; noble ones for sure, like the Frost Wolf and the Elk, but nasty pests too that are the Goblin-kind.

Stronghearted lumberjacks brave the wilds for the Winterpine Wood though, which is well renowned for its properties. But it can get dangerous out there, maybe more so now than ever. The spiteful goblins have been quite active, you see. May that act as a word of warning also, if you mean to venture out there.

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
You're the leader of the village?
Tell me something about your village.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: Why, it is the season for the Hearthlight Festival! Do you southeners not know of it? Out here it is tradition, to drive the cold and dark away, to warm our bodies and minds. We also exchange gifts for special tokens we share among each other - you too might find ways to earn, or even find some.

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
You're the leader of the village?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.

node.text:
In fact... why don't I give you a few...?

<color=#9C8C77>*The lady pulls simple, decorated, wooden tokens out of her pockets and hands them to you.*</color>

There you go, happy Hearthlight Festival!

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
You're the leader of the village?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.

node.text: But you must've made quite the journey to reach here, the Village of Evergreen Hearth! We're about the most remote settlement in the wilderness that is northern Imberthale, not many choose to live in such unforgiving land...

The village matron I'm sometimes called. Well, someone has to be, these men would be lost without me! Most of them are enthusiastic about swinging the hatchet, but when it comes to keeping a village in order, it's another matter.

option.optiontext: I've brought punishment to the goblins for their transgressions!
Remind me, what's the trouble with the goblins?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: We're safe here in the village, but out in the wilds it's a different matter. As my friend Gordon has been telling me, goblin attacks on our lumberjacks has become unbearable. The Frostfang Goblins have even been stealing their village festival tokens - the spite on those creatures!

Violence is the only language those vile creatures understand, we would be most appreciative if you'd teach them a lesson! If you venture out into the woods, you'll find they've spread their camps all around, to the north, south and middle.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Put the fear of death into the Frostfang Tribe by slaying 6 goblins at each of their three camps in the Winterpine Forests.*</color>

option.optiontext: You're the leader of the village?
Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I wasn't aware of any festivities, what's the celebration?

node.text: Is it true? Oh, but I knew he had the look of fierce warrior about him! Didn't I just say so, Gordon? Did I not say the fierce outlander will drive the goblins back for us and restore peace to the Hearthlight Festival?
Yes, ma'am, you did say so, though I did express great reservations myself...

Oh, Gordon, ever the sceptic! But truly, thank you, outlander - you've done a great service to our people! Now we can get on with...\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*A villager's scream in the distance cuts the Madam's sentence short!*</color>
How awful! What were those hissing monstrosities made of wind?! Thank you for protecting our village, outlander, twice now you've saved us from a bind! Dare I ask that you help us once more?

option.optiontext: What would you ask of me?

node.text: Whatever those wind monstrosities were, it's obvious that cackling goblin witch was behind it all! Oh, I'm afraid we underestimated the goblins, it may be the attacks we sent you to carry out may only have fueled their hatred...
Yeah...! We let an outsider meddle in our affairs, now things are worse than ever!
Oh, shush, Gordon - you're being silly! The outsider has done well, we simply didn't take into account that his cleansing of the forest may not have been thorough enough.
Whoever this goblin witch, I ask that you venture out into the woods on our behalf once more, track her down and put an end to her evil schemes for good!

option.optiontext: What do you know of the witch?
But how do you suggest I track her?

node.text: Hmm, that's a good question... the lumberjacks may know the woods the best, but all of them are too scared to venture out there now. As it happens though, we have a druid in the village.

I do not know much about him, but he has been very cordial with us and his kind are known for being close to the wilds. Perhaps if you ask him, he might have some way to reveal the witch's lair to you?

option.optiontext: I'll talk to him then.
option.actions: UpdateQuest=119-5,NpcChat=Thank you> outlander. The druid often hangs around outside this building> with his pet wolf.

node.text: Nothing, to speak the truth. We've not encountered her before, but she might be the leader of the Frostfang Goblins, or at least a very important figure among them. We steer clear of the goblins when we can, so we know little about them, beyond the nature of their vile hearts.

option.optiontext: So how do you suggest I track her?

node.text: May nature watch over you, friend. Even in a place such as this, where nature may seem cruel, it still has its purpose. But I will admit, even for one such as I, faced with the unrelenting cold, the warm village hearths do offer their temptation.

option.optiontext: A goblin witch hides in the woods, do you know of a way to track her?
I bring some elk meat for Woofy...
What's a druid doing all the way out here?
The wolf, is he your pet?
As you say.

node.text: Hmm, I may know of a way indeed... I take it she has been marked for death after her attack on the village. Are you to be the bane of Skrella Chillbone?

option.optiontext: You know of her?
Certainly, if that is her name.

node.text: I am familiar with most creatures of the forest. The goblins are hateful of all other living beings, they wish to dominate the wilds, and none so more than the witch Skrella. She knows tricks and treachery, and many old secrets of magic that are no doubt beyond me - she is not to be underestimated.

option.optiontext: What does she want with the villagers?
Let's get to the part where I track down her hideout.

node.text: Simply their destruction, of that I'm fairly certain. If humans did not drive back the goblin-kind from time to time, I expect they'd have free dominion over these woodlands.

option.optiontext: Tell me again, what do you know of her?
Let's get to the part where I track down her hideout.

node.text: Then meet my friend Woofy, the Snow Wolf. I did offer him many other, more flattering names, such as 'Stalker of the Tundra', or 'Ice Claw', but he much prefered 'Woofy'...
<color=#9C8C77>*Woofy looks at you with friendly eyes, though also with a healthy dose of suspicion.*</color>\n\nWoof!
Woofy has a very keen nose. If you take him out to the woods, I have no doubt he'll reveal the Goblin Witch to you in no time. But Woofy can be initially a little distrusting, hmm...
You could try offering him raw meat from the local elk, I believe it's his favorite.\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Offer 1 Raw Elk Meat to Woofy in order to befriend him and gain him as a follower.*</color>

option.optiontext: Here, boy... <color=#9C8C77>*Offer Raw Elk Meat to Woofy.*</color>
I see, I'll have to acquire some first.

node.text: Ah, but why would a druid not be here? The elements in these lands are arguably more raw, more pure. It is places such as these where a druid may discover a deeper connection with nature. Well, not exactly within this very village, perhaps, but out there in the wild.

option.optiontext: A goblin witch hides in the woods, do you know of a way to track her?
I bring some elk meat for Woofy...
The wolf, is he your pet?
As you say.

node.text: My kind do not believe in having 'pets'. No, I would rather call Woofy my friend. He's offered excellent companionship, especially in times I've been isolated from other humans. Woofy can be quite talkative, you see, if you have the ear to understand him.

option.optiontext: A goblin witch hides in the woods, do you know of a way to track her?
I bring some elk meat for Woofy...
What's a druid doing all the way out here?
As you say.
I hear you like elk meat, boy...

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Woofy eyes you warily and takes good care to sniff the meat you've offered him... but then he relaxes and chomps through the meat with great enthusiasm!*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Woofy's eyes light up, he now considers you a friend!*</color>\n\nWoof!

option.optiontext: Follow me, boy!

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Woofy whines and looks at you pleadingly. Woofy's appetite for elk meat has risen again...*</color>

option.optiontext: Here you go, boy...
Again, Woofy? Aww, I don't have meat for you right now...

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Woofy happily chomps through your meat! He then joins you as your companion once again.*</color>\n\nWoof!

option.optiontext: Follow me, boy!
Join me, boy!
Join me, boy!

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Woofy's happy to join your company, as ever!*</color>\n\nWoof!

option.optiontext: Follow me, boy!

node.text: I'm afraid we may have underestimated the goblins... Whatever the wind monstrosities that attacked our village, I have no doubt they were the work of that cackling goblin witch!

option.optiontext: You asked me to track her?
What do you know of her?
There's something I wanted to ask...

node.text: You've displayed exceptional heroism in defending our village already, I can think of no one better suited! Although the Witch may be making herself difficult to find... But as it happens, we have a druid in the village.

I do not know much about him, but he has been very cordial with us and his kind are known for being close to the wilds. Perhaps if you ask him, he might have some way to reveal the witch's lair to us?

option.optiontext: Where does the druid reside?
What do you know of the Goblin Witch?
There's something I wanted to ask...
I'll talk to him then.

node.text: I saw him only moments ago idling outside this very house, talking to his strange wolf friend...

option.optiontext: What do you know of the Goblin Witch?
There's something I wanted to ask...
I see.

node.text: Nothing, to speak the truth. We've not encountered her before, but she might be the leader of the Frostfang Goblins, or at least a very important figure among them. We steer clear of the goblins when we can, so we know little about them, beyond the nature of their vile hearts.

What we do know is that we cannot have her disturbing the peace of our village! Thus we ask that you find her and put an end to her schemes. Beyond that, maybe the druid outside is more familiar with her character.

option.optiontext: I'm not quite sure how to track her though...?
There's something I wanted to ask...
As you say.

node.text: What news, brave outlander? Have you had any luck in putting an end to the vicious schemes of the nasty goblin witch? I fear she seeks to ruin our festival entirely!

option.optiontext: She created many mirror images of herself, now I'm hunting for them...
I have defeated the Witch, but the power with which she attacked the village still lingers...
I have defeated the Witch, but the power with which she attacked the village still lingers...
I've discovered her hideout and I'm preparing to fight her...
There's something I wanted to ask...
Not yet.

node.text: Excellent work! I take it the druid and his wolf proved helpful then? Take care with the witch, outlander - who knows what vile tricks of magic she can perform!

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
Thanks for the warning.

node.text: I suspected the witch would prove tricksy! Hmm... Come to think of it, I heard shouting from the western side of the village just a while ago. Maybe one of her mirror images was causing trouble there?

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
Thanks, I might take a look.

node.text: Those monsters made of wind? Our village may never be safe if we can't get rid of them... Do you know of a way to stop it?

option.optiontext: When I hunted the mirror images of the witch, they dropped parts of a goblin effigy...
I have recovered this effigy from the witch...
There's something I wanted to ask...
Possibly, I'm working on it...

node.text: Hmm, perhaps the effigy is somehow linked to the monster of wind. Do you think you have all the parts? Maybe you'd be able to put it all together.

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
Yes, let's see...

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*Madam Vinter examines the effigy you have presented.*</color>\n\nHmm, perhaps it's indeed linked somehow to the monster of wind... Maybe you should see if it needs to be placed somewhere around the witch's lair?

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
That may be good advice, I'll see about it.

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*You tell Madam Vinter about the elemental spirit, Zephirix, the Cruel Wind of the North, and how you must defeat this foe in order to banish it once more.*</color>\n\nThat sounds horrifying! Now more than ever am I grateful that we have a brave hero such as yourself to aid us, for if you cannot banish it, I doubt none of us can!

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
Not to worry, I'll do my best.

node.text: What is it you wish to know, outlander?

option.optiontext: Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
Remind me, what's the celebration?

node.text: But you must've made quite the journey to reach here, the Village of Evergreen Hearth! We're about the most remote settlement in the wilderness that is northern Imberthale, not many choose to live in such unforgiving land...

The folk who do come are usually here for one of two reasons - as lumberjacks to gather the exceptional Winterpine Wood, or as traders. Sometimes druid-folk come and go, and of course someone also has to look after all of these fools - that job lands on my shoulders.

option.optiontext: I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
Remind me, what's the celebration?
I see.

node.text: Outside of the safe haven that is our village? Winterpine Forests are a wild, untamed land full of beasts; noble ones for sure, like the Frost Wolf and the Elk, but nasty pests too that are the Goblin-kind.

Stronghearted lumberjacks brave the wilds for the Winterpine Wood though, which is well renowned for its properties. But it can get dangerous out there, maybe more so now than ever. The spiteful goblins have been quite active, you see. May that act as a word of warning also, if you mean to venture out there.

option.optiontext: Remind me, what's the celebration?
Tell me something about your village.
I see.

node.text: Why, it is the season for the Hearthlight Festival! Do you southeners not know of it? Out here it is tradition, to drive the cold and dark away, to warm our bodies and minds. We also exchange gifts for special tokens we share among each other - you too might find ways to earn, or even find some.

option.optiontext: Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.
I see.

node.text:
In fact... why don't I give you a few...?

<color=#9C8C77>*The lady pulls simple, decorated, wooden tokens out of her pockets and hands them to you.*</color>

There you go, happy Hearthlight Festival!

option.optiontext: Tell me something about your village.
I was hoping to learn a bit about these lands.

node.text: O'ho, a nasty, meddling human makes its way to my cave? And he reeks of death, hah! Yesss, come closer, human... come and join my campfire...

option.optiontext: You are the Goblin Witch, Skrella, are you not?
You were the one who attacked the village - why?
Death has come to greet you, Witch.

node.text: Hah, nasssty human has heard of Skrella? Her reputation is greater than she knows... But Skrella knows of you too, meddling human. Oooh, yessss...
Why?! You ask why the wolf hunts the rabbit! Oh, I have sent many attacks against humans many times before, I have let them know they are not welcome here. Bah, still the stupid humans keep coming!
This land belongs to the Frostfang Tribe, and the tribe belongs to me, human! Now I have summoned a tide to wash your kind away from these lands for good! Hah!

option.optiontext: You are the Goblin Witch, Skrella, are you not?
Death has come to greet you, Witch.
We'll see about that...

node.text: Hahahaha! I think not, human! I am the oldest, most vicious of all goblins! You think you are first to try to take old Skrella's life? I have cheated death many times before!
And even my death will matter not! It will not end the wrath I have summoned! The Cruel Wind shall turn these forests into a frozen wasteland and wash from them the stench of humans! Hahahaha!

option.optiontext: What in the world is the Cruel Wind?
Are you talking about the creatures that attacked the village?
I can put an end to it, the same way I can put an end to you.
We'll see about that...

node.text: Once banished by druids, long since forgotten... but old Skrella rediscovered him, in her visions she found him... The great, merciless, heartless elemental spirit...! Zephirix the Cruel Wind is the perfect god for goblin-kind, and I have manifested his power!

option.optiontext: Is that what attacked the village?
I can put an end to it, the same way I can put an end to you.
It won't save you...

node.text: The human village suffered but a small taste of his power! The Cruel Wind is much more than that... I feed its fury and it grows. Soon the time will come and it will consume this land! Nothing will remain of your village then, hahaha!

option.optiontext: The Cruel Wind... but what is it?
I can put an end to it, the same way I can put an end to you.
We'll see about that...

node.text: Hah, you cannot! You will not see it, you cannot touch it! Only I have trapped its power into an effigy I crafted, and only through the effigy can the great elemental spirit be made manifest!

But good luck taking the effigy from me, meddling human! Hahaha! You will see, old Skrella has many tricks up her sleeve...\n\n<color=#9C8C77>*Without further warning, the Goblin Witch begins to chant a magical ritual!*</color>

You are the human I watched from the shadows, as you ran rampant through *my* lands, slaughtering *my* kin... And now you have the gall to come to my lair? Hah, suffering will be coming your way before long, human!

option.optiontext: You were the one who attacked the village - why?
Death has come to greet you, Witch.
We'll see about that...

node.text: What news, brave outlander? We heard quite the commotion coming from the woods. Is our village safe?

option.optiontext: Yes, I've thwarted the Goblin Witch and destroyed the elemental spirit she'd summoned.
Not yet.

node.text: Incredible! When I first asked for your aid, I did not imagine you would end up saving our village so thoroughly! Didn't I tell you, Gordon, that I had a great feeling about the outlander?
Hrmph... Yes, though I think our village should handle its problems without the need of outsiders. Really, I would have dealt with the witch myself! But I don't have powerful items, or any skills...
Oh, stop being such a sourpuss, Gordon! Anyway, thanks to you, outlander, we can finally celebrate the Hearthlight Festival in peace! I name you an honorary friend of Evergreen Hearth!

As such, I bestow upon you some of our festival tokens! Take them to our village peddlers and they'll give you a proper gift in return. Also, you have my blessing to purchase the cabin by the lake - its previous owner ran away and I don't think he's coming back.

option.optiontext: Thank you, Madam - enjoy your festival!

node.text: Happy Hearthlight Festival, honorary friend of Evergreen Hearth! May you find warmth and light beside our village fires! I hope you have been most successful in hunting our village festival tokens.

option.optiontext: There's something I wanted to ask...
Merry festival to you too, Madam.

node.text: Hello there! The festival is buzzing with excitement. What can I do for you?

option.optiontext: Who are you?

node.text: I’m Jans, a blacksmith with a passion for crafting masterpieces. And Coldstone Iron is my muse, I can never get enough of it. Tell you what, I'd be happy to trade some festival tokens for it.
If you happen to amass Coldstone Iron out there, why don't you consider trading it in for me?

option.optiontext: I do have Coldstone Iron I could trade.
Maybe later.

node.text: Hey, outlander, you’re back! Don't suppose you've got any Coldstone Iron for me to work my magic?

option.optiontext: I do have some I could trade.
Who are you again?

node.text: Ah, that's music to my ears! Let’s see what kind of haul you’re talking about.

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Trade 10 ore for 30 tokens.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Trade 1 ore for 2 tokens.*</color>
I changed my mind.

node.text: I’m Jans, a blacksmith with a passion for crafting masterpieces. And Coldstone Iron is my muse, I can never get enough of it. Tell you what, I'd be happy to trade some festival tokens for it.

option.optiontext: As it happens, I have Coldstone Iron.

node.text: Fantastic, and here are your tokens! This will fuel my work for some time. Though the appetite of my forge is never sated!

option.optiontext: That's not all...

node.text: What do we have here, then? Another outlander looking to trade wood for festival tokens?

option.optiontext: Who are you?

node.text: Just another, friendly village lumberjack. Toiling out here for the precious Winterpine wood same as you, I'm sure. It's all anyone ever wants, except for when they need festival tokens. I can help you with that.

option.optiontext: How so?

node.text: Simple stuff, help me lighten my load. Bring me logs of Winterpine and I'll share with you some of my festival tokens.

option.optiontext: I have Winterpine for you.
Not right now.

node.text: Back already, outlander? Have you come to trade Winterpine wood for tokens? I'm always up for it.

option.optiontext: I have Winterpine for you.
Who are you again?

node.text: That's always a pleasure. Come on then, let's see the goods.

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Trade 10 logs for 30 tokens.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Trade 1 log for 2 tokens.*</color>
I changed my mind.

node.text: Just another, friendly village lumberjack. Toiling out here for the precious Winterpine wood same as you, I'm sure. It's all anyone ever wants, except for when they need festival tokens. I can help you with that.

option.optiontext: I have Winterpine for you.

node.text: Oh nice, good haul - here’s your tokens. Now let me get back to work. Unless, of course, you have more to offer...?

option.optiontext: That's not all...

node.text: Hey! Got any fish to trade? I'd be happy to take them off your hands.

option.optiontext: Who are you?

node.text: Just a friendly village fisherman. I’m here to provide fish for the village festivities, though I prefer others do the catching for me.

option.optiontext: How does that work?

node.text: Simple - you bring me clearwater salmon from the lake, and I pay you with village festival tokens.

option.optiontext: I do have fish to trade.
Not right now.

node.text: Ah, you’re back! Got clearwater salmon for me? I'd be happy to take them off your hands, in exchange for festival tokens of course.

option.optiontext: I do have fish to trade.
Who are you again?
Never mind.

node.text: Brilliant! Let’s see what you’ve caught!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Trade 10 fish for 30 tokens.*</color>
<color=#9C8C77>*Trade 1 fish for 2 tokens.*</color>

node.text: Just a friendly village fisherman. I’m here to provide fish for the village festivities, though I prefer others do the catching for me.

option.optiontext: I do have fish to trade.
Never mind.

node.text: Nice catch! I'll make sure these get to the village. And here’s your tokens.

option.optiontext: That's not all...
It seems to be... alive?

node.text: Hey, sir! Check out my snowman! Isn’t it awesome? It’s the master of causing chaos!
This isn’t just any old snowman - it’s bewitched! And I've seen it throws snowballs at people when they’re not looking. It’s so funny!

option.optiontext: I could make use of the troublemaker, I'll give you festival tokens for it.
How did you manage to come by such a thing?
That's certainly something...

node.text: What? No way, this snowman is pure chaos, it's incredibly valuable! Although, tokens could buy me a ton of candy, hmm... Very well then, sir: one thousand tokens, no less, and it's a deal!

option.optiontext: How about I give you 500 festival tokens?
How did you manage to come by such a thing?
Nevermind then.

node.text: 500 tokens?! Alright, sir, sweet! You can take this master of chaos off my hands. Have fun dodging snowballs!

option.optiontext: <color=#9C8C77>*Make the trade.*</color>
Actually, I changed my mind...

node.text: Ha, this is the best trade ever! Now I can get so many candy cones, I can't believe it! Good luck with your new snowball-hurling buddy, sir!
I made it myself! Well, first I was sneaking in the woods, spying on a goblin witch! I saw it cast spells, animating the snow... I sneaked in after she was gone and collected that enchanted snow!

option.optiontext: I could make use of the troublemaker, I'll give you festival tokens for it.
Mighty brave of you.

node.text: Welcome to the Hearthside Lodge, outlander! Rest you bones by our warm fires, why don't you? This is a place of peace and contemplation.

option.optiontext: Is there anything you need help with?

node.text: Well, don't you just have the festival spirit in you, offering your help freely like that! Hmm, I might have a task for you, and I'll reward you with our festival tokens for it.

I'm struggling to keep the fires roaring in our Great Hearth, while also serving drinks and food to the village guests. Please, feel free to use my fancy runic axe to split some logs and keep the fires burning. I have stacked logs just outside for that very purpose.

option.optiontext: A runic axe, you say?
I see.

node.text: Quite so! I once found it buried beneath some rocks while foraging out in the woods. I thought it might've been the axe of a great warrior once, but the only thing it turned out to excel at was splitting firewood. Go and figure.

option.optiontext: Curious indeed.

node.text: So many fantastic wares to purchase at the village market, but where to store them safely while you go on about your business? Worry not, and welcome to Master Loyd's marvellous banking wagon! May I assist you in the safe storage of possessions?

option.optiontext: Yes please, I'd like to bank some items.

node.text: Come one, come all, don't be shy! The finest, quirkiest objects of festive cheer may be found here at my stall! How about you, my friend? Can I interest you in some of my wondrous curios?

option.optiontext: Yes, why not.
Exactly what are you peddling?
To be honest, no.

node.text: Why, I have in my travels collected fine objects that tickle the mind, both from afar and local, and I have brought them here to be shared with all during this great Hearthlight Festival!

Of course, there aren't enough to go around for all, so they're for the most part on display only, however...! For the dedicated few, it is possible to win some of my prized objects in exchange for village festival tokens, which are awarded to those who do service to the village in this time!

option.optiontext: Right, let's see these marvels of yours then.

node.text: Welcome to our village, traveler! Have you come to admire our festive wares? As is tradition, we've spent all year gathering wonderful treasures to bring on display during the Hearthlight Festival.

option.optiontext: I'd like to take a look.
What treasures have you found?

node.text: Some interesting books, I believe one even contains a measure of magical power! And a fine ring of incredible rarity... I could not part with it, except for the greatest measure of our festival tokens.

option.optiontext: I'd like to take a look.
I see.

node.text: Please keep the door shut, it's freezing outside! I only want to wear the most beautiful dresses in the realm, but this weather scarcely allows for it. Sometimes I feel like I was born in the wrong part of the world!

option.optiontext: What do you have?
You're a seamstress?

node.text: Yes, of course! But all the clothing's already reserved, I only have the local fabric left. Mind you, I only hand it out in exchange for festival tokens.

option.optiontext: What's the fabric good for?
Very well, let's take a look.
I see.

node.text: Well... The brutish locals often make bandages out of it, to help survive out in the wilds. Spirits forbid anyone around here would actually make anything fancy out of it.

option.optiontext: Very well, let's take a look.
I see.

node.text: Everyone's so obsessed with the Hearthlight Festival... Quirky artifacts aren't what folk need in their everyday lives! That's what I provide, even if my shop may not be as exciting as some of the market stalls out there.

option.optiontext: I'd like to see your wares.

node.text: Welcome to Evergreen Hearth! Our village festivities have already started, but it's not too late to join the fun! Please, attend the village hall when you have the time; the leader of our village, Madam Vinter, will wish to welcome you personally.

option.optiontext: Where do I find your village hall?
What can you tell me about your village?
What are the festivities?
Very well, thank you.

node.text: You'll find the village hall just down the street on the left. It's the grandest building in the village, and there's a druid lingering nearby - you really can't miss it!

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about your village?
What are the festivities?
Very well, thank you.

node.text: Ours is a peaceful village surrounded by dense forests. Most folks here are lumberjacks or traders, and we're well known for our warm hospitality and quality timber!

option.optiontext: What are the festivities?
Where do I find your village hall?
I see.

node.text: The Hearthlight Festival is the time we set aside our worries and light fires to drive away the cold and the dark. Delicious food and games will be enjoyed by all, and every craftsman puts up their finest wares on display!

option.optiontext: Where do I find your village hall?
What can you tell me about your village?
I see.

node.text: Welcome to our village, traveler! I hope you're enjoying the festivities.

option.optiontext: Where do I find your village hall?
What can you tell me about your village?
What are the festivities?
